alert.note: Alert for Becker (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 10 at 1:34PM CDT until July 10 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BECKER COUNTY... At 133 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Frazee, or near Detroit Lakes, moving southeast at 30 mph. At 130 PM CDT, broadcast media reported ping pong ball size hail near Little Cormorant Lake. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Broadcast media. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Detroit Lakes, Lake Park, Height Of Land Lake, Shoreham, Rochert, Westbury and Frazee. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near any lakes in southern Becker County, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
